import Mathlib

/--
If f : â„^n â†’ â„ is C^1 at x0 (i.e., has a continuous derivative at x0), then f is differentiable at x0.
This states the usual fact that C^1 implies differentiable (FrÃ©chet differentiability) at the point.
-/
theorem c1_implies_differentiable_at {n : â„•} {f : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ â„} {x0 : Fin n â†’ â„}
  (h : ContDiffAt â„ 1 f x0) : DifferentiableAt â„ f x0 := by sorry
